title: Scatter plots fail with shap_values.display_data = Pandas dataframe
body:
First of all we would like to thank the team of developers for their efforts. It's a great library.

This new version of SHAP 0.37 that will generate an object to store shap_values works with list type data, NumPy and Pandas but there are times when these types are changed to generate errors. This is an example and I would like you to review the code to be compatible with these types.

VersiÃ³n SHAP 0.37 (clone github 6 dic). The stable 0.37 has some other issues.

```python
import xgboost
import shap

X,y = shap.datasets.adult()
model = xgboost.XGBClassifier().fit(X, y)

explainer = shap.Explainer(model)
shap_values = explainer(X[:1000])

X_display,y = shap.datasets.adult(display=True)
shap_values.display_data = X_display.values   # NumPy

shap.plots.scatter(shap_values[:, "Age"], color=shap_values[:,"Workclass"])
```

This code work well but if we use a Pandas dataframe variable in display_data

```python
shap_values.display_data = X_display   # Pandas dataframe

shap.plots.scatter(shap_values[:, "Age"], color=shap_values[:,"Workclass"])
```

```
/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/pandas/core/generic.py in __getattr__(self, name)
   5137             if self._info_axis._can_hold_identifiers_and_holds_name(name):
   5138                 return self[name]
-> 5139             return object.__getattribute__(self, name)
   5140 
   5141     def __setattr__(self, name: str, value) -> None:

AttributeError: 'Series' object has no attribute 'reshape'
```
